sources.title: A Son of the Plains (1931) BOB CUSTER
sources.description:
üçïFirst Time on YouTubeüçï
Stars: Bob Custer, Doris Phillips, Al St. John
Director: Robert N. Bradbury

In this rare western, Bob Custer is after the elusive Polka Dot Bandit, responsible for a series of daring robberies.

TRIVIA: Born Raymond Anthony Glenn on October 18, 1898, in Frankfort, Kentucky, Bob Custer made his film debut in the 1920s and quickly became a popular figure in the B-Western genre. His rugged good looks and ability to perform his own stunts helped him stand out among the many cowboy stars of the era.

metadata.Plot: Brokaw, the Polka Dot Bandit, asks Farrell to help rob Wells Fargo. Farrell plans to capture Brokaw for the reward but is assumed to be one of the bandits and shot. Brent captures Brokaw, but Ann thinking her father is in on the robbery lets him go. Brent catches up with him only to be framed when the polka dot bandanna is found on his saddle.
metadata.Actors: Bob Custer, Doris Phillips, J.P. McGowan
